heaviest_rainfall.status: 47.89mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 09 November 2025, marking an exceptional 144.8 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 3 cold snaps, usually there are 3.6 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 0 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (219°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.7 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.7 mm) and pressure (down 6 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.3 mm) and feels like temperature (down 1.9°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 35.6m higher than yesterday, 48.8m lower than the past week, 64.5m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 557m to 849m and averaged 707.1m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: The sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and near calm conditions. Showers, the sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds, and bright intervals likely. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (94%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
